content.description:
Solo up to the ledge beneath the heavily pocketed wall - weird and scary (R).

Two bolt anchor for belay.

Launch up the overhang and wall above (crux) to the slabby last section.

Basically a two-pitch climb. Rappel down from the climb to the two-bolt anchor, then a short rappel back to the ground.
content.protection: Seven bolts, two bolt and sling anchor.

content.description: Climb the crack on the left side of the wall to a two bolt anchor.
Delicate and techy crack climbing on a gently over-hanging feature with tricky pro and inobvious sequences make this more than your average short .10d.
content.location: Located between Wild Garlic (the other crack on the wall to the left) and just left of Clean Sweep.

climbs.name: Poot
climbs.fa: Norman Boles and Brian Bennet circa 1990

content.description:
A tricky little number.

Balancy and tenuous to the first bolt. Step left, balancy and tenuous to the second bolt, crux step left to good holds and the anchor.
content.protection: Two bolts to a two bolt anchor with sling and rappel ring.

content.description: Overhung face to lower-angle crack and face. The initial section off the ledge is powerful, and a good belay is needed to avoid hitting the ledge (even with the closely spaced bolts). Approach via 5.9 climbing to the ledge.
content.protection: 5 bolts, pro to 2", double-length sling can be used to sling arch after 4th bolt. 2-bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Left side of the first wall, starting off the left side of the big ledge. Not to be confused with a new 5.11 sport route on the far left of the entire formation - which does not start from a ledge 20' off the deck.

content.description: Awesome overhung huecos on the far right side of the Windy Wall. Runout after 3rd bolt, with only some thin, questionable pro protecting the final roof/bulge. The anchor used to be a huge pile of webbing around a giant horn, but it was very ugly and visible even from the parking area. We removed the eyesore old anchor and replaced it with a 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks, and replaced the upper two bolts (the first had been replaced earlier).
content.protection: 3 bolts, a couple thin cams at top, 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks. First bolt is nearly useless and gives a lot of rope drag.
content.location: Obvious steep huecos on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: Steeply up to stand in a pocket (bolt). Up to an undercling then a fun little traverse right to stand in another pocket (bolt), the slab to the top.
content.protection: Two bolts on the climb and two (hangers only) for the anchor.
content.location: Left-most route on the wall - 2 bolts.

climbs.name: Holy Smokes
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, John Aughinbaugh, Bobbie Bensman, 1986

content.description: To the right of  "Scoot", Climb cracks and face, then left to a bolt and up to the "Scoot" anchors.

A fun route that makes you think with a great finish.

Make a couple tricky and balancy moves off the ground, stemming and using face holds and the finger seam to an insecure crack with marginal pro.  Continue up and left with good pro into the short but great hand crack to the anchors.
content.protection:
Assorted wires

Small to medium cams

Bolt anchor
content.location: Windy Wall, right side (see topo on previous page)

content.description: Fun Chimneying to a crack, then finish on slab.
content.location: Just to the right of Anaphyactic Freakout on the left side of Windy Wall.

content.description:
Great little sport climb that is pumpy, sustained and has moves that will make you feel, for lack of a better word, sexy. Which is why my wife and I have come to call it "sexy beast."

And it's one of the few 11a's that might be a bit on the soft side, rating-wise.
content.protection: Possible to set a stopper down low rather than highball the first bolt. Three bolts to cold shuts.

content.description: Nice little climb with brand new bolts (3). Sports a nice little mantle move just above the first bolt. Well worth it and ends on the same anchor (step around) as Allspice (10c).
content.protection: Anchors at the top of Allspice.

content.description: Face climb with plenty of crimping on grainy granite. Getting to the first bolt is the crux, it seems, with another crux up higher. Nice route.
content.protection: Three bolts and an rap anchor in a small, sit-down cave. Nice place to take stock of the scenery.
